intro: Aegiphila lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Aegiphila lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
